Sunny and crisp with highs in the upper 60s to low 70s. We‚Äôve gotten more rain than usual (the new usual) for three years in a row, including this one, which is weird because we had a drought that lasted a decade! I know it‚Äôs temporary, but for three years the weather has been, like, retro normal. Trees are healthy again, the streams and rivers are flowing ‚Äî it‚Äôs bizarre! html:
Finally! A sunny week. üåû

This is such a great time of year in the Bay Area. It‚Äôs still a bit wintry, but we usually get a few weeks in late February that are ridiculously perfect. Sunny and crisp with highs in the upper 60s to low 70s.

We‚Äôve gotten more rain than usual (the new usual) for three years in a row, including this one, which is weird because we had a drought that lasted a decade!

I know it‚Äôs temporary, but for three years the weather has been, like, retro normal. Trees are healthy again, the streams and rivers are flowing ‚Äî it‚Äôs bizarre!

This is the time of year one of my tabby‚Äôs favorite flowers bloomed. Tulips! He loved almost everything about them. (‚ÄúAlmost‚Äù because he did not like the fact that they‚Äôre toxic.)

Rosie loves this time of year too.

Not quite spring, but not quite the dead of winter either. During unseasonably warm weeks like this one, the grass starts growing, oak trees start blooming, squirrels are‚Ä¶squirreling, and butterflies and birds are flying.

There‚Äôs a lot of activity!

Marnie doesn‚Äôt have a super strong opinion on it either way‚Ä¶

Sure, she likes going outside for long walkies, but really, she fine using her treadmill too.

She isn‚Äôt very picky about her workouts. üòÜ

Your friendly neighborhood beauty addict,

Karen
